content:
The bike apparently updated correctly as the app indicated as such. However, when you go into one of the screens to update the settings it keeps timing out - your options are retry or cancel.

Forget even trying to contact the manufacturer for help. Crickets. This is just like when I emailed them a few weeks ago and asked for a manual for my bike that actually pertained to it, and they provided me with a link to the manual that I just complained about. 

It’s like a cross between Monty Python and Seinfeld, but without the humor. Hey - let’s have someone spend four figures - a lot of money - for a bike - and then provide them with a manual that literally has nothing to do with the bike you just purchased. Or, hey let’s have an app update and then it loses functionality and doesn’t work correctly. Who does that? Welcome to amateur hour.

content:
I have not had any issues with the app and it's easy to upload to Strava. I wish it would display in miles instead of Kilometers 
.
author: Wbsuth

content: Yeah. You can change the percentage of power in your motor settings,  but its already got a good range. You can map your rides on your phone, and upload it to Strava, but why not just use Strava? I tried it, don’t hate it, but iit gives me what I already had. My advice is, don’t use it unless you need to. If your bike is running just fine, don’t mess with it.  I’d like to see an app that gives a useful automatic assist, like a cruise control instead of a battery eater. I’d like to set up a PIN on the control unit. I’d like an app that really helps me get the most out of my bike. I don’t want an app that updates all the time with no visible difference. I want an app I can trust isn’t going to screw up my bike, but there’s a lot of negative rumors, and not a lot of positive reasons to use this from what I’ve seen so far.
author: Aloyzius6

content: The app is extremely disappointing from such a large company! Hire someone to fix it please. I’m starting to regret not going back to specialized. Absolutely nothing works correctly on this app. I would give it a zero star rating if I could.
author: Binkylady

content: I have had issues with the app crashing and then when I restart the app, all of the sudden my ride is measured in metric and cannot change it in the personal data settings because they aren’t available during a ride. I can do imperial-metric conversions, but when you’re training for a century and your app crashes 5 min into the ride, it’s hard to spend 75 miles (120ish KMs) solely in metric.
author: Isoldemeowmeow

content:
I’ve had a few problems with the app. My biggest is forgetting to log in while I have cell service and before I arrive at my trailhead because I usually don’t have cell service where I ride. Otherwise, it won’t open, I can’t see my battery status, speed, etc. It’s a big issue. I hate it but it’s all we’ve got. I’m trying to learn to live with it—by trying to remember to log in while I have cell service and not before I lose it, which can be tricky. 

However, since the big update, every time the app resets to metric. My profile still says Imperial but my bike control shows me kilometers to empty or kilometers per hour, which doesn’t help me to monitor my speed on public roads. It’s become an issue that when we pause our bike for too long and try to reconnect (like stopping to eat), it again resets my app to metric. My profile still shows Imperial but I can’t get to that while on a ride without closing the ride. In fact, in order to get it to reconnect, I have to close the app and pray it recognizes that I want to continue my ride when I reopen it, which has become the only way to reconnect. However, when I am able to reconnect, it reverts back to metric until I save my ride, go into settings, and then when I back out of settings, everything goes back to Imperial. Until I close and reopen my app again….

Prior to the big change a couple months ago, I loved everything about the app except that I need to log in while I have cell service or I can’t track my ride. The reconnect was a little funny because the “reconnect” would stay lit the rest of the ride even though we’d reconnected. That’s no longer an issue because the reconnect icon isn’t working for me anymore.
author: Roinva

content:
Does not work. Demands you update the bike’s firmware, and after spending twenty minutes doing that, says that it updated, and then tells you that you need to update your bike’s firmware. Repeat forever.

This is trash, whoever wrote it is an idiot, whoever let this through QA should be fired.
author: XaiaX

content: I would give a better review if I didn’t have to continually change my settings from metric to imperial every time I use the app… So frustrating. Why won’t the app remember my preferences?
author: Mavric08

content:
This app is useless   Every time I want to
Use it it needs updated   Enter email every time   Only works with internet   For freaks sake I am in the mountains where's there's no internet   I have only been able to use app 2 or 3 times   There's no record of any rides

content: The app needs to be able to connect to the bike and track rides and adjust settings without having cell service and logging in. Giant/Liv need the same.  Also, the last update made the app worse instead of better.

author: sheidhzgss

content: The new update made the auto power settings to lag more, specially while climbing. It switches very fast to the Tour-Eco  mode very fast when the road gets bumpy. It makes it difficult to climb without changing manually to a Sport/Power setting. It should have a delay changing power to any lower power mode, which will allow to keep pedaling smoothly on the uneven parts of the trail without feeling the lack of power. It should have a 2-5 seconds delay, while in auto mode, to go to a lower power mode, and no delay, to go to a higher power mode.  Do this and you’ll see how our reviews will change.

I can’t believe that this app makes me login while on the middle of the woods then says I need to connect to the internet! I’m miles away and want to know the charge in my main and booster batteries and I can’t. Who designed this app? I suspect someone who’s never ridden a Mtb. Additionally, this incompetently designed app does not support readings of the second Plus battery. While away from the internet you are left with five leds to tell you battery strength. It’s amazing that an app for $5000 to $12000 bikes has an app developed that is such a miss, and has been the center of complaints for four years. Giant obviously couldn’t care less.

And have a look at the BOT generated response that Giant has below this review. Same for everyone. There is never a real response since they do not care!

content: I would give zero stars if it would be possible. Remember, this is a MOUNTAIN bike. I am on the top of the mountain and want to check the exact charge of the battery to make sure I can reach home. After using it for two months without the need to log in, suddenly, the app asks for my email address and password. There is no cell phone coverage. The controller does not have an LCD display, so I have to use this app. My password does not work. The app is useless if you cannot log in. Why do I need to log into the app if anyone can connect to my bike standing in the vicinity using the Giant app with their account. The security should be on the bike, not on the app. It is not fair to restrict MY access to MY bike, just because you are collecting email addresses.

author: ET2RCT

content:
I thought that I would be able to use this app as a bike computer. However the basic numbers (eg speed) are displayed in a small font and not in a high contrast color scheme. You can switch to a screen without the map but the vital stats display in an even tinier font on this screen. 

Then there is no way to turn off GPS and use the stats (eg speed) from the bike. So you have the option of using the app and using battery sucking gps or not using the app. 

I was able to update the firmware on my bike and not brick it so thankful for  that and I can check bike status and change the sync drive levels. 

In my opinion useless as a ride computer or ride tracker based on the above two issues.
